title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1045.12 - Explosives, acids, inflammables, compressed gases, and other dangerous substances
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1045.12 - Explosives, acids, inflammables, compressed gases, and other dangerous substances

State Regulations
(a) No
person shall bring into or carry in the transit center or onto a bus any
explosives, acids, inflammables, compressed gases or articles or materials
having or capable of producing strong offensive odors, explosion or fire, or
articles or materials likely to endanger persons or property. (b) No person shall bring or cause to be
brought into or kept at the transit center or onto a bus any signal flare or
any container filled with or which has been emptied or partially emptied of
oil, gas petroleum products, paint or varnish. When authority is given to bring
into or keep at the transit center any such articles or materials it shall be
conditioned upon the use of appropriate receptacles in rooms or areas approved
therefor by the transit center manager. Notes

1045.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
